alert.note: Alert for Guernsey (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:49PM EST until February 20 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC059-181600- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0010.220218T0721Z-220220T1430Z/ /CDIO1.1.ER.220218T0721Z.220218T1800Z.220220T0830Z.NO/ 1049 PM EST Thu Feb 17 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wills Creek at Cambridge. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Overflowing of poor drainage and low lying areas will result in minor flooding along wills creek. At 16.0 feet, Basement flooding begins through floor drains and other sewer connections. Local interruptions in sanitary service may occur along Gordon`s Run from 3rd Street to 6th Street. At 17.0 feet, Water overflows wills Creek Valley Road to a depth of 2 feet. Water reaches a depth of 1 foot on North Eighth Street. At 18.0 feet, Flood waters begin effecting apartments along Wills Creek Valley Road. Southgate Parkway will also begin flooding near Woodlawn Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 17.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 03/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
